WorkItem.Description:
5.0.5 was released and I was very looking forward to finally being able to use Rawr again for my protpally.  unfortunately your stats are stll wrong.

I set my Pally to unbuffed vs a lvl 90 enemy. and compared to my toon in the Blizzard arsenal / ingame.

here are the results.

"IS"  is the right value I have and how it should be shown

"SHOWN" is the value RAWR shows me but is obliviously wrong.


HP is 657907
HP shown 608137

Stamina is: 36536
shown: 32981


Strength is: 13501
Strength shown: 14113.13

Armor is: 59279
Armor shown: 58351

Miss:  changed in moP to 3%
shown 5%

Dodge is: 1639 (7.04%)
Shown: 1619 (7.00%)

Parry is: 2039 (20.27%)
shown: 1951 (20.04%)

Mastery is: 2242
shwon: 2895.5

Block is: 25.17% 
shown: 25.83%

Haste is: 10309 (24.26%)
shown: 10206 (24.01%)

Hit is: 2553 (7.51)
shown: 2483 (7.30)

Expertise is: 5124 (15.07)
shown: 5019 (14.76)


here is my Palladin for comparison: http://eu.battle.net/wow/en/character/zirkel-des-cenarius/Schroom/advanced
best regards.

Comments.Message: My guess is you have some items that are upgraded via VP, and rawr can not tell the difference between a 496 peice or a upgraded peice that is 504. That would be for the HP, not sure about the strength.

I can take a look at it later.  I should warn you that I'm not sure that Prot Paladin will ever be really that great, as my understanding of tank math is kinda fuzzy.  Unfortunately, it will be a little while, as my first priority is getting the 5.2 items in.  Thanks for your feedback, though.  I would also agree that it probably has to do with some upgraded 496 ilevel piece(s), as we are still working on supporting item upgrades.
